column4: I'm using an nVidia driver for my graphics card and for some reason i can't pull a window from one LCD to another. any ideas?
What view type did you choose when you ran `sudo nvidia-settings` , did you choose Twin-View?
you were saying before raylu chirped in ?
i can navigate my pointer to either screen except when dragging a window.
so when draggin the window it just stop's you at the screen border? .. I'm trying to get one of my test systems to replicate this .. botch monitor's are same resolution right ?
both monitors are not the same resolution but i do resize the window before dragging it.
it's been a while since i've used ubuntu deeply, where is x.org located?

Sorry , I was doing a bit of reading touching up on xorg.conf config's... had to dust off a book ~ I don't see anything that should be stopping you from doing this.. just out of pure pure pure curiosity, drag the window the opposite direction from where the LCD is , see if your #0 #1 are wrong ~
nope. I know my other monitor is digitally positioned correctly because i can move my mouse in that direction and it appears in the next monitor.
K, I'm kind of at a loss atm, nothing I can find or think of should be stopping you .
out curiosity... should my pointer be left behind on one monitor while another pointer is on the other?
